constructor.details: Disables the regular constructor to make the contract upgradeable.

returns.exists_: True if a contract with this name is registered.
returns.isActive_: True if the contract exists and is marked as active.

returns._0: The address of the contract, or address(0) if not found.

returns.registrar_: The address that registered the contract.

returns._0: The name of the contract, or an empty string if not found.

params.contractType_: The type of contracts to retrieve.
params.limit: The maximum number of contracts to return.

returns.addressesPage: A memory array of the addresses of matching contracts.
returns.namesPage: A memory array of the names of matching contracts.
returns.totalMatchingContracts: The total number of contracts of the specified type.

initialize(address,address).details: Sets the initial owner and the AccessControl contract address. Can only be called once.

params.accessControlAddress_: The address of the AccessControl contract.
params.initialOwner_: The initial owner of the registry.

params.limit: The maximum number of names to return.

returns.page: A memory array of contract names.
returns.totalContracts: The total number of registered contracts.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

registerContract(string,address,string,s.details: The name must be unique, and the address must not already be registered.

params.contractAddress_: The address of the contract being registered.
params.contractType_: The category or type of the contract.
params.name: The unique name to identify the contract.

returns.success: A boolean indicating if the operation was successful.

removeContract(string).details: This operation removes the contract from all lookups and enumeration arrays. It uses the "swap and pop" technique on all tracking arrays for O(1) gas complexity.

params.name: The name of the contract to remove.

returns.success: A boolean indicating if the operation was successful.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.active: The new active status (true or false).
params.name: The name of the contract.

returns.success: A boolean indicating if the operation was successful.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.name: The name of the contract to update.
params.newContractAddress: The new address for the contract.
params.newVersion: The new version for the contract.

returns.success: A boolean indicating if the operation was successful.

accessControl().notice: The contract that controls roles and permissions.

contractExists(string).notice: Checks if a contract with a given name exists and is active.

getContractAddress(string).notice: Retrieves the address of a contract by its registered name.

getContractCount().notice: Gets the total number of contracts registered.

getContractInfo(string).notice: Retrieves all information for a contract by its registered name.

getContractName(address).notice: Retrieves the registered name of a contract by its address.

getContractsByType(string,uint256,uint25.notice: Retrieves a paginated list of contracts belonging to a specific type.

listContracts(uint256,uint256).notice: Lists all registered contract names with pagination.

registerContract(string,address,string,s.notice: Registers a new contract in the registry.

removeContract(string).notice: Removes a contract entirely from the registry.

setContractActive(string,bool).notice: Sets the active status of a registered contract.

updateContract(string,address,string).notice: Updates the address and version of an existing contract in the registry.
